# Lovers Rock - Climbing Dating App

**Goal**: Niche dating app for climbers to find belay partners and dates using React Native + Expo.

## Tech Stack
- React Native + Expo Router v6 (file-based routing)
- TypeScript (strict)
- PocketBase backend (future)
- Ionicons for UI icons
- useState/useEffect for state

## Folder Structure
```
app/(tabs)/
  _layout.tsx       # 3-tab navigation (Discover, Matches, Profile)
  index.tsx         # Discover feed
  matches.tsx, 
  profile.tsx
  chat/[matchId].tsx   # Chat screen (future)
src/
  components/ClimberCard.tsx
  services/mockData.ts
  types/climber.ts
```

## Climber Type
```typescript
interface Climber {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  age: number;
  grade: 'beginner' | 'intermediate' | 'advanced' | 'expert' | 'elite';
  climbing_styles: ('bouldering' | 'sport' | 'trad' | 'speed' | 'gym' | 'outdoor')[];
  home_gym: string;
  bio: string;
  image_url: string;
}
```

## Standards
- Functional components only (arrow functions)
- Strict TS (no `any`)
- File names: Components=PascalCase, Services/Types=camelCase
- Imports: `@/src/...` and `@/components/...`
- All mock services return Promises (simulating API)
- Console logs can be used for debugggin but dont overuse them by adding to every step
- Comment only important functions at the top of the function

## Running
```bash
npm start  # Scan QR with Expo Go
pocketbase serve --http=0.0.0.0:8090 # Start PocketBase server
```
